perturbation.original_text:
4.1 Party A and Party B unanimously agree that they will allocate the proceeds generated from cooperation in accordance with thefollowing provisions:

Party B shall have the right to charge, on a quarterly basis, the service fee ("Service Fee") from Party A or its subsidiaries who have accepted Party B's Services, or designate another person to charge Service Fee from Party A or its subsidiaries who have accepted Party B's Services. The total sum of Service Fee shall be equal to the amount of profits gained by Party A or its subsidiaries who have accepted Party B's Services. Party B shall have the right to adjust the amount of Service Fee at its own discretion, without the prior consent of Party A or its subsidiaries.
perturbation.changed_text:
4.1 Party A and Party B unanimously agree that they will allocate the proceeds generated from cooperation in accordance with thefollowing provisions:

Party B shall have the right to charge, on a quarterly basis, the service fee ("Service Fee") from Party A or its subsidiaries who have accepted Party B's Services, or designate another person to charge Service Fee from Party A or its subsidiaries who have accepted Party B's Services. The total sum of Service Fee shall be a mutually agreed upon amount, taking into account market conditions and the value of the services provided. Party B shall have the right to adjust the amount of Service Fee with the prior consent of Party A or its subsidiaries, which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding the Service Fee. Initially, Party B could unilaterally adjust the fee. The modification requires mutual agreement, contradicting the original, creating ambiguity over fee adjustment rights.

perturbation.original_text:
5. Term of Cooperation

Party A and Party B agree and confirm that the term of cooperation under this Agreement shall commence from the execution date hereof and end on the expiration date of the operation term of Party B ("Term of Cooperation").
perturbation.changed_text:
5. Term of Cooperation

Party A and Party B agree and confirm that the term of cooperation under this Agreement shall commence from the execution date hereof and end five (5) years from the execution date hereof, unless terminated earlier as provided in Article 6 ("Term of Cooperation").
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction in the Term of Cooperation. The original definition stated it ends on Party B's operation term expiration, while the altered definition specifies a fixed five-year term. This conflicting term length creates uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text: 8.2 The demand for liquidated damages and specific performance in respect of any breach during the Term of Cooperation are all remedies that the non-breaching Party shall have under this Agreement. The non-breaching Party shall waive the right to request termination of this Agreement it may have according to any applicable laws as a result of the violation acts committed by the breaching Party.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.2 The demand for liquidated damages and specific performance in respect of any breach during the Term of Cooperation are the primary remedies that the non-breaching Party shall have under this Agreement; however, in cases of gross negligence or willful misconduct by the breaching party, the non-breaching Party may also seek equitable relief, including termination of the agreement. The non-breaching Party generally waives the right to request termination of this Agreement it may have according to any applicable laws as a result of the violation acts committed by the breaching Party, unless the breach constitutes a material and irreparable harm.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding remedies for breach. The original text limits remedies to liquidated damages and specific performance and waives the right to termination. The modified version allows for equitable relief and termination in specific circumstances, contradicting the waiver and creating ambiguity on available remedies.
